alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:10PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Several strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coconino County along I-40 near Williams through 245 PM MST... At 208 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Ash Fork to near Williams to Parks. Movement was northwest at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall that is reducing visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williams, Parks, Dogtown Lake Campground and Kaibab Lake Campground. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 163 and 165. Interstate 40 between mile markers 151 and 179. State Route 64 between mile markers 186 and 192. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding and very slick roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rainfall will lead to periods of reduced visibility along I-40.
